info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 2:51PM MDT until June 22 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Union County in northeastern New Mexico... Northeastern Colfax County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 251 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sugarite Canyon State Park, or 9 miles northeast of Raton, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Folsom, Sugarite, Capulin and Sugarite Canyon State Park. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 369 and 378. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This thunderstorm is capable of producing all types of severe weather including extremely large hail, destructive straight line winds and tornadoes. Move quickly to a safe shelter such as an interior room, a bathroom, closet or basement.
